name: Math Game 2.0
description:
Technically this would be the forth Math's game I have made but it is the second one I have finished to a point I can publish it here.

Pick between 10 - 100 questions and 5 lessons to try. Every question is randomly generated.

  1. Lesson 1 is Addition.
  2. Lesson 2 is Subtraction.
  3. Lesson 3 is Multiplication.
  4. Lesson 4 is Division.
  5. Lesson 5 is a mix of all of them.

There are 3 difficulty settings. Easy, Medium and Hard.

Because the questions are randomly generated some of them are repeated, especially in Easy difficulty. Which is fine because repetition is a good way to learn math. 

Difficulty ranges from 5 to 12 year old's. Some question even take me a little time to answer.

When you complete your lesson it will show your results and ask if you want to try again. Also it will save your Name, Lesson and Difficulty to a txt file. It will also save all answers to the text file and if there is an answer that is wrong it will save the correction underneath it. 

The game is played in the windows console atm but I am thinking of moving it into the Raylib game engine. 

I made this by request of my father for the kids to learn. So I decided to share it here.

If I end up making a Raylib version of it I will post it here as a second copy of the game.

Thank you.
